events.originalText: Researchers announced the discovery of the Happisburgh footprints (pictured) in Norfolk, England, the oldest known hominid footprints outside Africa at more than 800,000 years old.
events.subtitle: Happisburgh footprints
events.headline: Oldest hominid footprints found in Norfolk, England

events.originalText: An inquiry report of the United Nations Human Rights Council found systematic and wide-ranging violations of human rights in North Korea.
events.subtitle: Report of the Commission of Inquiry on Human Rights in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea
events.headline: UN report reveals human rights violations in North Korea

events.originalText: President Ilham Aliyev issued a decree on the redenomination of Azerbaijan's currency, with 1 new manat equal to 5000 old manats.
events.subtitle: Ilham Aliyev
events.headline: Azerbaijan redenominates currency with 1 new manat equal to 5000 old manats

events.originalText: Abdullah II became the reigning King of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan following the death of his father King Hussein.
events.subtitle: Abdullah II of Jordan
events.headline: Abdullah II becomes King of Jordan after father's death

events.originalText: Steve Jobs returned to Apple Inc. as a consultant after the company's acquisition of his technology startup NeXT.
events.subtitle: Steve Jobs
events.headline: Steve Jobs returns to Apple after NeXT acquisition

events.originalText: Ramzi Yousef, one of the main perpetrators of the 1993 World Trade Center bombing and the bombing of Philippine Airlines Flight 434, was arrested in Islamabad, Pakistan.
events.subtitle: Ramzi Yousef
events.headline: 1993 World Trade Center bombing suspect arrested in Pakistan

events.originalText: Having retired four months earlier, American basketball player Michael Jordan signed a contract with the Chicago White Sox to play baseball.
events.subtitle: Michael Jordan
events.headline: Michael Jordan signs contract with Chicago White Sox to play baseball

events.originalText: The Maastricht Treaty, which led to the formation of the European Union, was signed by the member states of the European Communities.
events.subtitle: Maastricht Treaty
events.headline: Maastricht Treaty signed, leading to formation of European Union

events.originalText: The Troubles: The Provisional Irish Republican Army shelled 10 Downing Street with mortars in a failed attempt to assassinate British prime minister John Major.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: IRA shells 10 Downing Street in failed assassination attempt

events.originalText: President of Haiti Jean-Claude Duvalier fled the country after a popular uprising, ending 28 years of one-family rule in the nation.
events.subtitle: Jean-Claude Duvalier
events.headline: Haiti's President Duvalier flees after popular uprising

events.originalText: During the Space Shuttle Challenger mission STS-41-B, astronauts Bruce McCandless II and Robert L. Stewart performed the first untethered spacewalk (pictured).
events.subtitle: Space Shuttle Challenger
events.headline: First untethered spacewalk performed during Challenger mission

events.originalText: Neil Harvey became the youngest Australian to score a century in Test cricket.
events.subtitle: Neil Harvey
events.headline: Neil Harvey youngest Australian to score Test century

events.originalText: World War II: Japan successfully withdrew its troops from Guadalcanal.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japan successfully withdraws troops from Guadalcanal in WWII

events.originalText: Soviet border guards opened fire on civilians attempting to cross the border from the Soviet Union to Romania near Lunca, killing several hundred people.
events.subtitle: Lunca massacre
events.headline: Soviet border guards kill civilians near Romania border

events.originalText: Walt Disney's Pinocchio, the first animated feature to win a competitive Academy Award, debuted at the Center Theatre in New York City.
events.subtitle: Walt Disney
events.headline: Pinocchio debuts as first animated feature to win Academy Award

events.originalText: Kid Auto Races at Venice, featuring the first appearance of comedy actor Charlie Chaplin's character the Tramp, was released.
events.subtitle: Kid Auto Races at Venice
events.headline: Charlie Chaplin's Tramp character makes first appearance

events.originalText: A Chinese immigrant in San Francisco fell ill with the bubonic plague in the first epidemic of the disease in the continental United States.
events.subtitle: Bubonic plague
events.headline: First bubonic plague epidemic in continental US reported in San Francisco

events.originalText: Napoleonic Wars: Two evenly matched French and British frigates fought for four hours at the Îles de Los off the Guinean coast, resulting in a stalemate.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: French and British frigates fight to stalemate off Guinean coast

events.originalText: The Eleventh Amendment to the United States Constitution, limiting the ability of U.S. citizens and foreign nationals to sue U.S. states in federal courts, was ratified.
events.subtitle: Eleventh Amendment to the United States Constitution
events.headline: Eleventh Amendment ratified, limiting lawsuits against US states

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: After three years and seven months, Spain and France abandoned their attempt to capture Gibraltar from the British.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Spain and France abandon attempt to capture Gibraltar from British

events.originalText: Supporters of the Dominican preacher Girolamo Savonarola collected and publicly burned thousands of vanity items such as cosmetics, art and books in Florence, Italy.
events.subtitle: Dominican Order
events.headline: Supporters of Girolamo Savonarola burn vanity items in Florence

events.originalText: Leo I (pictured), who ruled for nearly 20 years, was crowned Byzantine emperor.
events.subtitle: Leo I (emperor)
events.headline: Leo I crowned Byzantine emperor
